content:
@nikomatsakis I think it might be a good idea to add another section to the shiny future FAQ: "what are some potential pitfalls in this shiny future?" (or something similar). It would be good to think a bit about what potentially could go wrong if we end up in a future like the one described: is async code less efficient? Do we run the risk of hiding too much abstraction behind "magic"?

Thoughts?
I thought that was the purpose of this section
but in general I've found the FAQ template for shiny future a bit cumbersome
so I wouldn't be opposed to simplifying it
Ah, yes I guess I didn't fully grok what that question was asking. Maybe it needs to be reworded
Let's tweak them
I've also not found the "character-by-character" questions very helpful
They were meant to focus on attributes of Rust
e.g., Think about Grace's top priority (memory safety) and the expectations she brings (still able to use all the tricks she knows and loves). How do they fare in this future?
but I think it's distracting, it tends to be like "what does a C programmer think"
the idea of having 4 questions was to force people to think about all the things, but I've found it kind of leads to spread out or repetitive answers
I also think I'm missing something a bit like the "morals" -- like, what are the key attributes of this shiny future
going to make a hackmd to sketch
shiny future FAQs
ok, @rylev, take a look
Looks good. I would caution against the last question. it's good to get a high-level overview of things needed to reach the shiny future, but this document is not meant to be a technical RFC
The part I really want is Are there parts of this future you don't know how to implement or solve?
interestingly my goal with this was to encourage people to have such parts
maybe I'll just keep that
